author: wsjcom
title: Trump Builds Trust Because He Keeps Election Promises
text: The headline of William A. Galston’s “Trump Needs to Learn How to Trust” (Politics & Ideas, May 9) caught my attention—and triggered my irony detector. He stresses President Trump’s need to project “a degree of mutual trust and reciprocal loyalty” in maintaining alliances with other countries, eschewing zero-sum thinking. However, despite President Trump’s repeatedly telling everyone what he’s going to do (roll back regulations, decrease taxes, dismantle ObamaCare, drop out of the Paris climate accord, renegotiate trade agreements, pull out of the Iran nuclear agreement and address the North Korean threat) and then...
